description: From Middle English draperie, from Old French draperie, from drap (“drape, sheet, large cloth”), ultimately of Germanic origin.

entries.meaning: (countable) A piece of cloth, hung vertically as a curtain; a drape.
The occupation of a draper; cloth-making, or dealing in cloth.
examples: He made also statutes for the maintenance of drapery and the keeping of wools within the realm

entries.meaning: Cloth, or woollen materials in general.
examples: people who ought to be weighing out grocery or measuring out drapery
